Our Methodology When Ranking Instant Payout Casinos in Australia


We ranked the best instant withdrawal casinos in Australia, our methodology focused on the following criteria:

  • Safe Gambling Experience:Â We only considered an online casino if it offers Australian players a safe gambling experience. All of the top providers discussed are regulated. Moreover, games are provided by licensed software developers, many of which provide electronic games to land-based casinos in Australia.
  • Instant Payouts: Our methodology only included online casinos that offer instant payouts. This means the casino processes withdrawal requests immediately, or within minutes.
  • Wide Selection of Games: We focused on instant payout casinos with a broad selection of games. We looked for variations of blackjack, roulette, baccarat, and video poker, plus a large range of slots. We gave extra preference to casinos that double up as a sportsbook.
  • Generous Bonuses With Fair Terms: The best online casinos listed on this page not only offer generous bonuses but with fair terms and conditions. This means wagering requirements that players can realistically achieve in the stated time frame.
  • Data Protection: Many Australians are concerned about data breaches when gambling online. Therefore, our methodology focused on casinos that offer a private gambling experience. This means no KYC procedures or requests for personal information.

How to Pick the Best Online Casino in Australia With Fast Payouts


Navigating through dozens of instant withdrawal casinos in Australia can be a daunting task. To ensure you select the best option, we’ve created a checklist of important considerations.

Read on for guidance on how to choose a top-rated online casino with speedy payouts.

Payout Times

If your main priority is fast payouts, the first step is to assess how long the casino takes to approve withdrawals. If the casino offers instant payouts, this information is often displayed on its homepage. That said, it’s worth browsing through its terms and conditions.

We came across several casinos advertising instant withdrawals, but the terms and conditions yielded some concerning clauses. For instance, some casinos put limits on how much can be withdrawn each day. The best option is to select a casino that automates its payout processes.

Lucky Block, for example, automatically approves withdrawals. For added security, you’ll need to confirm the withdrawal via two-factor authentication. After that, the cryptocurrencies will be sent to the blockchain. This means the funds will arrive in your wallet in a few minutes, depending on the network.

If you don’t feel comfortable using cryptocurrencies, Lucky Block, Mega Dice, and other top-rated providers also support debit/credit cards. However, due to increased anti-money laundering controls, fiat money payouts require additional checks. This means you won’t benefit from instant withdrawals like you get with cryptocurrencies.

Safety and Regulation

The best instant withdrawal casinos in Australia are located offshore. This means that you won’t be protected under Australian consumer laws. As such, it’s very important to use a reputable online casino that is well-regulated. This is why we rate Lucky Block as the best online casino in Australia with fast payouts.

Lucky Block has secured a remote gambling license from the Governor of CuraÃ§ao. This ensures that Australians can deposit and withdraw funds safely and that they can gamble in fair conditions. Moreover, Lucky Block has formed partnerships with regulated casino software providers. Examples include Evolution, NetEnt, Microgaming, and Pragmatic Play.

We would strongly suggest that you choose another casino if you come across an unregulated provider. What’s more, you should also check third-party review sites in Australia. This will enable you to evaluate the experiences of current players, especially when it comes to withdrawal times.

Data protection is another aspect to consider when choosing an online casino. After all, privacy laws in Australia have required various amendments in recent years due to large-scale data breaches. Fortunately, the best Bitcoin betting sites discussed on this page do not have a KYC process.

In simple terms, this means you won’t need to provide personal information or ID verification documents. This is on the proviso you deposit, gamble, and withdraw cryptocurrencies.Â  Therefore, data breaches are no longer a risk.

Accepted Payment Methods

As mentioned, instant withdrawal casinos in Australia specialize in cryptocurrency payments. When researching a casino, check which cryptocurrencies it accepts.

Most cryptocurrency casinos accept Bitcoin and a range of altcoins. This should include Ethereum, Tether, BNB, and other popular digital assets.

Supported Gambling Games

In addition to fast payouts and a safe regulatory framework, you’ll want to check what gambling games the casino supports. For example, BC.Game is one of the best options for playing live dealer games. It supports 584 live tables across blackjack, craps, roulette, video poker, and baccarat.

This will appeal to players who want the ‘real’ casino experience while playing online. If you’re more interested in pokies, Mega Dice is worth considering. Mega Dice offers over 4,000 pokie titles, covering Megaways and bonus buys. It also offers jackpot slots with low minimum bet requirements.

Importantly, it’s wise to check what software providers supply games to your chosen casino site. We prefer established software providers that are regulated by a reputable gambling body. For example, Pragmatic Play – which supplies games to Lucky Block, Mega Dice, and BC.Game is certified and licensed in over 20 countries.

Alternatively, if you’re looking to place sports bets with competitive odds, Lucky Block is the stand-out provider. Its sportsbook covers over 40 sports, including footy, cricket, rugby league, rugby union, snooker, and darts. It also supports esports games like League of Legends and FIFA.

Casino Bonuses and PromotionsÂ 

When choosing an online casino in Australia with real money and easy withdrawals, don’t forget about bonuses. This is a very competitive landscape with over 100 operators competing for your business. Therefore, you should ‘milk’ as many welcome packages as you can.

But before claiming a sign-up bonus, you’ll want to check the terms and conditions.Â This ensures that the bonus comes with fair wagering requirements.

Some of the best Bitcoin casino bonuses come as a matched deposit. For example, Lucky Block matches the first deposit by 200% up to â¬10,000 or about $15,500. Mega Dice also matches the first deposit by 200%, up to 1 BTC. Both Lucky Block and Mega Dice also offer 50 spins. These are risk-free and simply require a minimum deposit of â¬20 (about $33) to qualify.

We found that Wild.io is one of the best instant withdrawal casinos in Australia for regular promotions. These are bonuses offered to existing players. For instance, Wild.io offers free spins, cashback, and deposit reloads throughout the week. It’s also worth exploring loyalty programs.

The casino will credit your account with loyalty points whenever you place bets. As more points are accumulated, you’ll be upgraded to the next loyalty tier. As you keep climbing the loyalty ladder, you’ll be able to exchange your points for bonuses and other perks.

Accessibility

There are several factors to consider when exploring accessibility. First, the instant withdrawal casino should offer a smooth sign-up process. As we mentioned, casinos specializing in cryptocurrencies rarely have a KYC process in place. This means you only need to provide an email address.

This won’t be the case when using a traditional online casino. On the contrary, you’ll need to provide KYC documents, such as a passport or driver’s license. This means it can take a couple of days to get set up, as the casino will need to manually review the documents.

If privacy is one of your main priorities, consider using a casino that operates on Telegram. Mega Dice has a popular Telegram casino that doesn’t require an account to be opened. All you need is a verified Telegram account, which only requires a mobile number. For more information, we’ve created a beginner’s guide on the best Telegram casinos.

Make sure your chosen casino accepts Australian players. Even if the casino offers KYC-free accounts, it might block Australian IP addresses. We found that some Australian players will use a VPN to make it appear they’re from another country.

User ExperienceÂ 

The best instant withdrawal casinos in Australia offer a great user experience. This means a simple account opening process alongside hassle-free deposits. The user experience should also be positive when withdrawing funds. You shouldn’t be required to wait around for the withdrawal to be processed.

This is why we prefer cryptocurrency casinos, as payouts are usually approved instantly. What’s more, the casino should make it seamless to search for and play games. Loading times should be fast and the gaming experience should cover both desktop and mobile devices.

Customer ServiceÂ 

Using an instant payout casino outside of Australia can be daunting if you don’t have access to good customer service. In most cases, offshore casinos service players from around the world, meaning the customer service team operates 24 hours per day, seven days per week.

This is the case with Lucky Block, Mega Dice, BC.Game, and many other providers discussed today.Â We found that you’ll usually be connected to a live chat agent in seconds. This means you receive answers to your concerns straight away, rather than needing to wait for an email reply.

How do Online Casino Payouts Work?


Most online casinos in Australia follow a similar process when it comes to payouts. First, players must request a withdrawal from within their account dashboard. The amount must be stated and the funds will need to be transferred to the same payment method.

This ensures the casino complies with anti-money laundering (AML) regulations. After all, ASIC recently fined Star Entertainment Group $150 million for AML violations. Once the player confirms the payout request, it will then be sent to the casino’s payment team. Our research shows that on average, it takes 24-48 hours for online casinos to approve payouts.

Additional delays can occur if the request is made over the weekend. The casino will manually check the withdrawal and the respective player’s account. Once satisfied everything is in check, they will process the withdrawal. If the funds are being sent back to a debit/credit card, it will likely take an additional 48 hours to arrive. Bank payments can take even longer.

In addition, the first withdrawal made by players is often the slowest. This is because you can usually open an account and deposit funds without needing to upload ID verification documents. However, requests for documents will arrive when you make the initial withdrawal request.

The KYC process requires a government-issued ID and a recently-issued proof of address. Once submitted, you’ll need to wait for the casino to verify them. This can add further delays, as it can take a few days for the documents to be approved. And, if there are any issues (such as an unclear document), you’ll need to submit the documents again.

Now consider the payout process when using a cryptocurrency-centric casino, such as Lucky Block or Mega Dice. As soon as the payout request is made, it will be approved instantly. The cryptocurrency tokens will be transferred to the player’s wallet. It’s important the correct wallet address is entered, as mistakes cannot be rectified once the transfer is made.

Thereon, it should only take a few minutes for the winnings to arrive in the wallet. That said, specific times are dependent on the blockchain network. Bitcoin, for example, is one of the slowest blockchains, so you’ll need to wait around 10 minutes. Other cryptocurrencies, like Dogecoin, Shiba Inu, and Tether are considerably faster.

Whatâs Considered a Fast Casino Withdrawal Time?


We’ve established that regular online casinos usually take about 24-48 hours to approve withdrawals. Don’t forget, once approved, you still need to wait for the debit/credit card issuer or bank account provider to credit the payment. This can take an extra couple of days.

Nonetheless, same-day withdrawals would be considered fast, as this beats the industry average. For this guide, we’ve focused on Australian casinos that offer instant payouts. This means that withdrawal requests are automatically approved. After that, you’ll just need to wait for the blockchain network to verify the transaction.

Do note that in rare instances, there might be a slight delay when withdrawing funds from an instant withdrawal casino. For instance, if you request a cryptocurrency withdrawal to be sent to a new wallet address, the casino will likely ask for confirmation. This is to protect players from unauthorized withdrawals. Moreover, delays can also occur if additional anti-money laundering checks are required. This could be because of suspicious betting patterns or abnormally large wagers.

Conclusion


We’ve researched and reviewed the best instant withdrawal casinos in Australia. We select Lucky Block as the best option. Lucky Block is a regulated casino and sportsbook that approves payouts instantly.

It supports thousands of games and first-time customers will receive 50 free spins and a 200% deposit bonus. Lucky Block also offers top-notch customer support via live chat, 24/7.

The post 9 Best Decentralized Crypto Wallets for 2023 appeared first on Cryptonews.

]]> Decentralized crypto wallets, otherwise referred to as non-custodial or self-custody – give users full control of their private keys.

But which decentralized wallet is best?

In this guide, we compare the best decentralized crypto wallets for smartphone and desktop users. We also cover decentralized hardware wallets, which may appeal to long-term investors.

List of the Best Decentralized Crypto Wallets


Here’s an overview of the best decentralized crypto wallets in 2023:

  1. Best Wallet – New decentralized wallet that offers a secure way to store and trade tokens as well as exciting features that make it more than just a wallet. That includes staking rewards, reduced trading fees, and early access to new projects via its $BEST token, which will be airdropped to early adopters of the platform. Best Wallet will also offer unique insights into trending tokens – an account can be created in less than five minutes with no KYC verification required.
  2. MetaMask – This decentralized wallet is used by over 30 million investors. Available as a mobile app and browser extension, MetaMask supports all ERC20 tokens. It also supports other network standards, including Polygon, Avalanche, Binance Smart Chain, and Arbitrum. However, MetaMask is not compatible with Bitcoin.
  3. Trust Wallet – Launched in 2017, Trust Wallet is also available as a mobile app or browser extension. Not only does Trust Wallet support Bitcoin – but 70 other network standards. Trust Wallet is also suitable for accessing the decentralized web.
  4. OKX – Backed by one of the world’s largest crypto exchanges, OKX is a decentralized wallet app for iOS and Android users. It supports dozens of blockchain standards and aggregates data from more than 200 DeFi platforms. This allows OKX users to swap tokens to earn interest at market-leading rates. However, Bitcoin is not supported.
  5. Trezor – This hardware wallet provider offers a cold storage solution for long-term investors. Depending on the chosen model, Trezor retails for $69 or $219. Not only does Trezor remain offline at all times, but users need to enter a PIN to transfer funds. This is one of the most secure decentralized wallets but also the least convenient.
  6. Coinbase Wallet – Backed by the Coinbase exchange, this decentralized wallet is compatible with iOS and Android devices. It supports thousands of cryptocurrencies and NFTs from multiple blockchain networks. Users have full control of their private keys when using the Coinbase Wallet.
  7. Electrum – One of the original Bitcoin wallets, this decentralized desktop software is compatible with Windows, Mac, and Linux. There is also an Android app, but no support for iOS. Electrum enables users to keep their private keys offline, providing a secure and cost-effective alternative to hardware wallets.
  8. Crypto.com – Used by over 80 million people, Crypto.com is a popular exchange that also offers a decentralized wallet app. This top DeFi wallet comes packed with features, including interest accounts, an NFT marketplace, and an in-built token swap tool.
  9. BitAddress – This provider offers free paper wallets, enabling users to keep their crypto tokens offline. It takes just seconds to create a new wallet address, and private keys can be printed via a QR code.

Best Decentralized Crypto Wallets: Full Reviews


In this section, we review the best decentralized crypto wallets for 2023.

This will enable users to select the best decentralized crypto wallet for their needs.

1. Best Wallet – Overall Best Decentralized Crypto Wallet with Exciting Added Features

Best Wallet is a brand new self-custody software wallet that is already our overall best crypto wallet and our best decentralized wallet.

It is not just a wallet to store and transfer tokens, however, with Best Wallet offering numerous unique and enhanced features that take it beyond rivals in the market.

As a self-custody wallet, Best Wallet accounts can be created in under five minutes with only an active email address and four-digit passcode needed to get started.

As one of the best no-KYC crypto exchanges users will not have to enter any KYC details – such as names, address, or their date of birth – and have the option to choose two-factor authentication and/or fingerprint ID for enhanced security.

Best Wallet has multi-chain functionality and also a built-in decentralized exchange which means users are able to purchase, trade, transfer and hold thousands of different tokens securely and anonymously.

It is its other features that see Best Wallet stick out ahead of the crowd, with its native token $BEST enabling a raft of unique utility that makes it a top pick.

$BEST tokens have not yet been launched but will enable token holders to earn staking rewards, get reduced trading/gas fees and earn early access into high-potential new crypto projects. Best Wallet will also soon have NFT functionality and will enable purchases, transfer, and storage of NFTs, as well as having a gallery to display collections.

Another top feature is its crypto news feed and unique insights and data into new and trending tokens and airdrops, which will allow users to stay ahead of the competition.

$BEST tokens will be launched in the coming weeks with early adopters of the platform to be rewarded with an airdrop – 10% of the max supply will be distributed to active users of the wallet.

Pros

  • Overall Best decentralized crypto wallet
  • Multi-chain functionality and DEX
  • Native $BEST token can be staked and opens other features
  • Quick sign-up with no KYC verification
  • Enhanced security
  • Early access to new projects and NFTs
  • Unique insights on new cryptos

Cons

  • Some features not yet live

Visit Best Wallet

2. MetaMask – Popular Decentralized Wallet for Storing ERC-20 Tokens and NFTs

MetaMask is one of the best DeFi crypto wallets for storing Ethereum and other ERC-20 tokens. Used by over 30 million people, MetaMask is free to download. Users can choose from the mobile app for iOS and Android or a web browser extension. The latter includes Chrome, Edge, Brave, and Firefox.

MetaMask provides users with a 12-word backup passphrase when creating a wallet. Only the user has access to the passphrase, ensuring that MetaMask remains decentralized at all times. The wallet is secured by a password, which needs to be entered when opening it.

While MetaMask supports a range of other networks, by default, it only connects to Ethereum. Other networks can be added manually. This includes Polygon, Avalanche, Binance Smart Chain, and Arbitrum. However, there is a lack of support for many notable blockchains. In addition to Bitcoin, this includes some of the best altcoins – such as Cardano, Solana, and XRP.

Nonetheless, this popular XRP wallet comes with an in-built staking tool that connects to Rocket Pool and Lido. Currently, these staking pools offer APYs of 3.8% and 4.3% on Ethereum deposits, respectively. For more options, MetaMask can be connected to decentralized applications. This can be done within the wallet interface or externally.

MetaMask also offers an in-built token-swapping tool. This enables users to trade tokens without going through a centralized exchange. All supported network standards are compatible. However, once again, better rates are often available when connecting to dApps like UniSwap or PancakeSwap.

MetaMask has also partnered with various third parties to process debit/credit card and e-wallet payments. This includes Sardine, MoonPey, PayPal, and Transak. Users are redirected to a supported payment provider based on their location and required cryptocurrencies.

See our full MetaMask review.

Pros

  • Free decentralized wallet app and browser extension
  • One of the best decentralized crypto wallets for storing ERC20 tokens
  • Supports NFT storage
  • In-built staking and token swap tools

Cons

  • Charges 0.875% for token swaps
  • Only Ethereum is supported for staking
  • Is not compatible with Bitcoin, Solana, Cardano, and other leading cryptocurrencies

3. Trust Wallet – Popular DeFi Wallet With Over 60 Million Users Â 

With over 60 million users, Trust Wallet is one of the most popular cryptocurrency wallets in the market. Trust Wallet was purchased by Binance in 2018, but this is a decentralized wallet nonetheless. Only the user has access to their private keys – which are displayed as a 12-word passphrase when setting the wallet up.

Trust Wallet is available as an app or browser extension. Supported operating systems include iOS, Android, and Chrome. The wallet is free to download and supports over 70 blockchains. According to Trust Wallet, this means that over 4.5 million digital assets are supported.

This includes some of the best cryptocurrencies to buy, such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, Solana, BNB, and Cardano. Core features include an in-built staking tool that supports multiple coins. This includes everything from Tezos, Tron, and Cosmos to BNB, Kava, and Algorand. Trust Wallet also supports in-wallet token swaps.

There are no fees charged when swapping tokens or using the Trust Wallet staking tool. However, more competitive exchange rates and APYs are often available elsewhere. Fortunately, Trust Wallet seamlessly connects to dApps such as UniSwap and SushiSwap.

If Trust Wallet doesn’t fit with your investing needs, our guide on the best Trust Wallet alternatives is a must read.

Pros

  • Used by over 60 million crypto investors
  • Compatible with over 4.5 million cryptocurrencies and NFTs
  • Easily access dApps like Uniswap and OpenSea
  • No fees when using the in-built staking tool

Cons

  • Uses MoonPay and Simplex for debit/credit card payments
  • No support for Firefox browsers

4. OKX – Decentralized Wallet App With Aggregator Tool to Maximize Yields Â Â 

OKX is also one of the best decentralized crypto wallets to consider today. Backed by one of the world’s leading exchanges, OKX is compatible with iOS and Android devices. It is free to download and comes packed with features. At the forefront of this is its exchange aggregator tool.

In simple terms, OKX scrapes data from over 200 DeFi exchanges. This allows investors to find the highest APYs when earning interest via staking, yield farming, and crypto savings accounts. Best of all, there is no requirement to visit external DeFi exchanges.

Instead, the OKX aggregator tool allows users to complete their investments via the wallet interface. Moreover, the OKX wallet also supports in-built token swaps. Users will almost always secure the best exchange rates, considering the aggregator tool checks over 200 platforms.

In terms of fees, OKX adds a markup when swapping tokens or earning interest. While there is no fixed commission, fees are clearly displayed before confirming orders. Finally, OKX supports dozens of blockchain networks – including Ethereum, Binance Smart Chain, and Arbitrum. However, there is no support for Bitcoin.

Pros

  • Best decentralized crypto wallet app for iOS and Android
  • Aggregates APYs and exchange rates from over 200 DeFi platforms
  • Supports NFT storage and trading
  • Compatible with dozens of blockchains, covering some of the best emerging cryptocurrencies

Cons

  • Does not support Bitcoin
  • Not the most user-friendly wallet in the market

5. Trezor – Self-Custody Hardware Wallet Aimed at Long-Term Crypto Investors Â  Â 

Trezor is one of the best decentralized crypto wallets for security. Retailing from $69, the Trezor device allows investors to keep their cryptocurrencies in cold storage. In simple terms, this means that Trezor is never connected to live servers.

As such, the cryptocurrencies stored are kept away from remote hackers at all times. That said, Trezor will not appeal to those that actively trade or move cryptocurrencies. This is because to transfer tokens out of Trezor, users need access to the device.

Only after entering the PIN on the Trezor device is the transaction authorized. Nonetheless, Trezor connects to its native app for iOS and Android. This allows users to view their cryptocurrency balances, with real-time valuations.

The Trezor app also allows users to buy cryptocurrencies with a debit/credit card and other fiat payment methods. However, watch out for fees, as fiat payments are processed by third parties. Finally, Trezor supports over 1,000 cryptocurrencies. This includes Bitcoin and some of the best utility tokens, such as Ethereum, Polygon, and XRP.

Pros

  • Best decentralized crypto wallet for cold storage
  • $69 for the entry-level device
  • Supports over 1,000 cryptocurrencies
  • Check portfolio values via the Trezor app

Cons

  • The high-end model costs $219
  • Does not directly support decentralized token swaps
  • Fiat payments are processed by third parties

6. Coinbase Wallet – User-Friendly DeFi Wallet for iOS and Android Devices Â Â 

Coinbase Wallet is a decentralized wallet app for iOS and Android. This wallet is completely separate from the main Coinbase exchange – which is centralized. As such, Coinbase Wallet users have full control of their cryptocurrencies and private keys.

The wallet is free to download and ideal for beginners exploring non-custodial storage for the first time. In fact, setting up the wallet takes seconds. Users simply need to choose a strong password and write down their backup passphrase.

The Coinbase Wallet states that it supports hundreds of thousands of coins. This includes large-cap cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Tether, Dogecoin, Polygon, and Solana. Coinbase Wallet also supports the Ethereum and Binance Smart Chain networks.

As such, all ERC20 and BSC tokens are supported. Coinbase Wallet allows users to explore the decentralized web and connect to dApps like Uniswap and Compound. While in-built token swaps are not supported, this can be achieved by connecting to a dApp.

Pros

  • Best decentralized cryptocurrency wallet for beginners
  • Compatible with hundreds of thousands of cryptocurrencies and NFTs
  • Only users have access to their private keys

Cons

  • Does not directly support in-wallet token swaps
  • Staking is only available when connecting to a dApp
  • No browser extension

7. Electrum – Best Crypto DeFi Wallet for Storing Bitcoin on a Desktop Device Â Â 

Those looking to store Bitcoin on a laptop or PC might consider Electrum the best decentralized wallet. It’s compatible with Windows, Linux, and Mac and completely free to use. Electrum is one of the most established Bitcoin wallets, first launching in 2011.

While it comes with limited features, it’s packed with security tools. For example, Electrum enables users to keep their private keys in cold storage. This means the private keys remain offline until the user wants to make a transfer.

Another security tool offered by Electrum is multi-signature permissions. This requires users to authorize outgoing transfers across two or more wallets. Like most decentralized wallets, Electrum is protected by a password.

If this is forgotten or the device is lost, damaged, or stolen – the wallet can be recovered with the backup passphrase. Finally, Electrum also offers a mobile app for Android smartphones. Unfortunately for Apple users, there are no plans to release an iOS version.

Pros

  • No-frill decentralized wallet for desktop devices
  • Also supports an Android app
  • Keep private keys in cold storage at all times
  • Completely free of charge

Cons

  • Only supports one cryptocurrency – Bitcoin
  • No trading features
  • Does not support interest yields

8. Crypto.com – Feature-Rich DeFi Wallet Supporting Interest Accounts Â Â 

Crypto.com is a leading crypto exchange that also offers a decentralized wallet. This is a non-custodial wallet app for iOS and Android. There is also a browser extension and desktop software for those that prefer using a laptop device.

Crypto.com supports over 1,000 cryptocurrencies across 30+ network standards. This includes Bitcoin, Ethereum, Polkadot, and its own network – Crypto.org Chain. The wallet is protected by a password and backup passphrase.

The latter – which consists of a 12, 18, or 24-word passphrase, is displayed when setting up the wallet. Crypto.com enables users to set their own GAS fees when transferring funds. This supports efficient transactions based on real-time GAS prices.

That said, one of the best features of the Crypto.com wallet is its in-built support for interest accounts. This supports over 25 cryptocurrencies, including Cronos, Cosmos, and Dai. Alternatively, the Crypto.com wallet can also connect to dApps like MM Finance and VVS Finance.

Pros

  • Supports over 30 blockchain networks
  • Compatible with Windows, Mac, iOS, Android, and Chrome
  • In-built interest accounts for over 25 cryptocurrencies
  • Buy and sell NFTs

Cons

  • Does not display token swap fees
  • Higher interest yields are available on external dApps

9. BitAddress – Open-Sourced Paper Wallet Provider for Free Cold Storage Â  Â Â 

BitAddress is the best decentralized crypto wallet for cost-effective cold storage. Unlike Trezor and Ledger Nano, BitAddress is completely free to use. This is because BitAddress is a ‘paper’ wallet solution. Here’s how it works. First, users visit the BitAddress website to create a new wallet address.

Within seconds, BitAddress will display two unique barcodes. One represents the wallet address. The other is the wallet’s private keys. The user can then transfer Bitcoin to the wallet address and finally – print the two bar codes onto a sheet of paper and keep it somewhere safe.

In doing so, the Bitcoin tokens remain offline at all times. If the user wants to transfer the tokens to another wallet, they can scan the private key QR code. This imports the wallet credentials to the next wallet location.

In terms of safety, BitAddress is an open-sourced provider that merely creates Bitcoin wallet addresses and private keys. This means it is the user’s responsibility to keep their credentials safe. Finally, BitAddress only supports Bitcoin – so this option won’t be suitable for diversified portfolios.

Pros

  • Create unlimited Bitcoin paper wallets
  • Completely decentralized – private keys are encrypted
  • Free of charge
  • Wallet addresses and private keys are represented by QR codes

Cons

  • Not suitable for active crypto traders that regularly move funds
  • Does not support altcoins

What is a Decentralized Wallet?

Decentralized wallets give users full control of their crypto investments. Unlike centralized wallets, only the user has access to their private keys.

In a nutshell, decentralized wallets allow users to store their cryptocurrency tokens safely. This is because users control their private keys.

This is in contrast to centralized wallets, which are often provided by cryptocurrency exchanges or brokers. This is because centralized wallets do not provide users with their private keys. This means users need to trust the centralized provider will keep their funds safe.

Importantly, when setting up a decentralized wallet, private keys are usually provided in a simplified form. This is often a 12-word passphrase that needs to be entered in the correct order. Nonetheless, the decentralized wallet provider will never have access to the private keys.

This means users are responsible for safeguarding their wallets. If the wallet is compromised or the private keys are misplaced – the provider cannot help recover the funds.

Benefits of Using a Decentralized Crypto Wallet

Some of the core benefits provided by decentralized wallets include sole custody of the private keys, access to dApps, and faster transaction times.

Still not sure if a decentralized wallet is the best option?

Here are some of the benefits of using a decentralized wallet for storing cryptocurrencies.

Full Control of Crypto Tokens

The main attraction of decentralized wallets is that users control their funds. This is because only the user has access to their private keys.

As such, only the user can authorize outgoing transactions. Moreover, entities – whether that’s the wallet provider or the government, cannot access the crypto funds.

This allows users to store wealth outside of the conventional financial system. In other words, users do not need to trust decentralized wallet providers as they do with centralized exchanges.

Faster Transactions

The best decentralized crypto wallets offer much faster transaction times when compared to centralized options.

This is because there is no requirement to have the transaction authorized by a third party.

  • For example, consider the process involved when storing crypto tokens on a centralized exchange
  • First, the user would need to request a withdrawal from the exchange
  • The user would need to wait for the exchange to approve the transfer
  • This could take minutes, hours, or days – this can vary widely depending on the centralized exchange
  • Once approved, only then will the crypto tokens be transferred to the recipient

In comparison, there is no third-party approval process with decentralized wallets. As such, the transaction will be executed on the blockchain as soon as it is verified by the wallet owner.

Store a Great Number of Tokens

When using a centralized wallet, the number of supported tokens will often be limited. This is because users can only store tokens that are supported by the exchange.

In comparison, the best DeFi wallets support thousands, sometimes millions, of cryptocurrencies.

Take Trust Wallet as a prime example. We found that Trust Wallet is compatible with over 70 blockchain networks and 4.5 million cryptocurrencies and NFTs. This enables investors to store all of their digital assets in one safe place.

Access Web 3.0 dAppsÂ 

The best decentralized crypto wallets provide seamless access to Web 3.0 dApps.

Some of the most commonly supported dApps include:

  • UniSwap
  • SushiSwap
  • PancakeSwap
  • OpenSea
  • Compound
  • Yearn.finance

But there are hundreds more. Crucially, these dApps offer access to decentralized finance tools, such as token swaps, staking, yield farming, and dual investments.

Anonymity Â 

Another popular feature of decentralized crypto wallets is they offer complete anonymity. This means users can create a wallet without providing any personal information or contact details.

All users need to access their wallet is the respective password or private keys.

Centralized vs Decentralized Wallets

The responsibility of ‘custodianship’ is how DeFi and centralized wallets are differentiated. Centralized wallet providers are tasked with keeping the user’s cryptocurrencies safe. While DeFi wallets give users full control – meaning they are responsible for looking after their private keys.

DeFi and centralized wallets both enable users to store their cryptocurrency tokens. The key difference is in who takes responsibility for safeguarding the wallet’s private keys.

In the case of centralized wallets, private keys are secured by the provider. This is often a crypto exchange or broker. As such, users do not have access to their private keys. In turn, if the custodian is hacked or goes bankrupt (like FTX), the user’s crypto funds are at risk.

DeFi crypto wallets, on the other hand, give users full control of their funds and private keys. This means that there is no reliance on a third-party custodian. Users can send and receive funds at any time without needing approval from another person or entity.

However, there is nowhere to turn if the DeFi wallet is hacked or the user loses their private keys. Therefore, while DeFi wallets give users control of their wealth – appropriate security practices should be taken.

This means keeping the private keys offline at all times – preferably written down on a sheet of paper. In doing so, the user can recover their wallet if they forget their password or the device is lost or stolen.

Different Types of DeFi Wallets


Now that we have established the difference between centralized and DeFi wallets, we can explore the different types available.

Software Wallets

Most crypto investors opt for a software-based decentralized wallet. Software wallets are often referred to as ‘hot storage’. This is because the funds remain online at all times, increasing both convenience and risk.

Software wallets come in many forms, but mobile apps are particularly popular. Decentralized wallets like MetaMask and Trust Wallet both offer an app for iOS and Android. This enables users to secure their crypto funds with a PIN or fingerprint ID.

Mobile wallets are very convenient for actively managing crypto portfolios. At the click of a button, users can send, receive, and trade crypto right from their smartphones.

Software wallets also come as a browser extension. For example, MetaMask offers an extension for Chrome, Edge, Brave, and Firefox browsers. This enables users to access the crypto markets whenever they are on their laptops.

Some decentralized wallets come as desktop software, but this is less common. One of the most popular desktop wallets is Electrum, which safely stores Bitcoin on Windows, Mac, and Linux.

Hardware Wallets

Hardware wallets allow users to store their cryptocurrencies on a device. The private keys are held on the device and kept offline at all times.

To transfer crypto to another wallet, users must enter a PIN on the hardware device. This offers an ultra-secure way to store large amounts of crypto.

Equally, hardware wallets are far from convenient for active crypto traders. This is because making last-minute trades is cumbersome, considering access to the hardware device is needed.

The leading hardware wallet providers are Trezor and Ledger Nano. Both are decentralized, as neither provider has access to the device’s private keys.

However, do remember that users will need to provide some personal and financial information when buying a hardware wallet online.

Paper Wallets

Paper wallets also offer a decentralized way to store crypto tokens. As we mentioned earlier, BitAddress allows users to instantly create a Bitcoin wallet address and private keys.

Both are represented by a QR code, which the user can print onto a sheet of paper. As long as the paper is kept somewhere safe and private, the crypto funds remain unhackable.

How Secure Are Decentralized Crypto Wallets?


First and foremost, there is no requirement to trust a third party when using a decentralized wallet. After all, decentralized wallets merely provide a bridge between crypto transactions and the blockchain.

However, decentralized wallets will always be at risk from remote hacking attempts and theft. As such, users must ensure that they follow sensible security practices to keep their crypto funds safe.

For example, those using a mobile wallet should ensure that a suitable PIN is used. This should be in addition to a lock-screen password for the smartphone. If someone is able to bypass these security measures, they will have access to the wallet.

This is also the case for desktop and browser extension wallets. Another way for hackers to access a decentralized wallet is through ‘links’. For example, a scammer might impersonate the wallet’s support team and send a link for the user to click.

Unwittingly, the link might install a virus or keylogger, enabling the scammer to access the wallet remotely. The safeguard here is to never click links from unknown sources – whether that’s on social media or emails.

The safest option is to keep the crypto wallet offline at all times. For example, consider installing the wallet on a cheap smartphone that is never connected to the internet. Similarly, users might also consider a paper wallet that is stored away from the risk of theft or damage,

Ultimately, decentralized wallets are safe, but users must also take responsibility too. Users also need to consider that increased convenience often leads to reduced security.

For example, while software wallets are convenient for actively trading and investing crypto, the private keys will always be vulnerable to hackers. As such, users should only keep small amounts of crypto in a software wallet.

How to Select the Best Decentralized Crypto Wallet?


Choosing a suitable wallet is a crucial part of the crypto investing process.

Therefore, this section highlights the most important factors to look for when choosing the best decentralized crypto wallet.

Security

Decentralized wallets provide users with their private keys, ensuring that wealth is built and maintained without third parties.

However, decentralized wallets are still vulnerable to hackers. As such, choosing the best decentralized wallet requires users to consider what security features are included.

For example:

  • Mobile wallets like Trust Wallet and MetaMask are secured by a PIN
  • Desktop and browser-based wallets are secured by a password
  • Hardware wallets are secured via cold storage. Plus, users need to enter a PIN on the device to transfer funds

In comparison, centralized wallets offer additional security features. This can include device whitelisting, two-factor authentication, and even insurance.

Supported Networks

The number and type of blockchain networks supported by decentralized wallets will vary wildly. For example, Trust Wallet supports over 70 networks. This includes Bitcoin, Solana, Cardano, Litecoin, and some of the best meme coins – like Dogecoin and Shiba Inu.

In contrast, Electrum only supports one cryptocurrency – Bitcoin. Crucially, users should check which networks and cryptocurrencies are supported by choosing a decentralized wallet.

Device Type

Consider the most convenient and secure device type to store the decentralized crypto wallet. Options include desktop software, browser extensions, and mobile apps.

For offline storage, consider a hardware or paper wallet.

User-Friendliness

Another factor to consider is user-friendliness.

For instance, beginners should explore whether the chosen decentralized wallet is suitable for their skill set. Sending and receiving crypto should be simple, as should setting up and securing the wallet.

More experienced crypto investors might seek a crypto wallet with more advanced features. For example, Electrum offers multi-signature permissions. While this adds a great level of security to the wallet, this feature is not suitable for newbies.

Investment and Trading Features

The best decentralized wallets enable users to maximize their crypto investments. For example, OKX has an in-built aggregator tool that connects to over 200 dApps.

Users can search for the crypto they currently hold in the OKX wallet and locate the highest APYs available. OKX also comes with an in-built token-swapping tool, not to mention a fully-fledged NFT marketplace.

In contrast, the likes of BitAddress and Electrum do not offer any such features.

Tutorial on How to Use a Decentralized Crypto Wallet


Below, we offer a step-by-step tutorial on how to set up an account and use our top decentralized wallet, Best Wallet, which should only take five minutes.

Step 1: Download Best Wallet App

First, find the Best Wallet app, which is available on mobile for Android and iOS in the App Store and the Play Store and download it.

A desktop browser extension is currently in development and will be released soon.

Step 2: Create an Account

As a leading self-custody, decentralized wallet, all that’s needed to create an account is an active email address.

There is no KYC requirements to fill in, allowing for anonymous storage and transfers.

Step 3: Choose Security Settings

Next, choose the level of security you wish to attach to the account.

All accounts will require a four-digit passcode to be input and confirmed, while there is the option to add two-factor authentication and/or fingerprint ID.

Once that step is complete, an account will have been created, but users should head to the settings tab and note down their private key.

Step 4: Use Best Wallet

An account has now been created and users will be redirected to Best Wallet dashboard, where they will be able to purchase or store crypto an trade on the built-in DEX.

As outlined above, some features are not yet live at the time of writing but will be launched in the coming weeks and months.

Conclusion


In summary, decentralized wallets offer many benefits for crypto investors. This includes having full control of the wallet’s private keys, enabling investors to become their own bank.

Decentralized wallets are also ideal for connecting to Web3 applications, as well as remaining anonymous. That said, do remember that decentralized wallets also invite risk. If the wallet is hacked or the user loses their private keys – the crypto funds will likely be unrecoverable.

Therefore, it is important to choose wisely when selecting a decentralized wallet, with Best Wallet our top pick and an excellent choice. The self-custody wallet allows for accounts to be created in less than five minutes with no KYC verification needed, with users able to securely store crypto and trade tokens via built-in DEX.

It stands out ahead of its rivals because it is more than just a crypto wallet – its native token $BEST can be staked to earn rewards and holding it also grants other benefits such as early access to new projects and NFTS and reduced fees, while the platform will also offer unique insights and data on trending tokens.

$BEST is not yet live but will be airdropped to active users of the wallet in the near future.

Visit Best Wallet

Best Decentralized Crypto Wallets FAQs

Which wallets are decentralized?

There are dozens of decentralized crypto wallets in the market – ranging from Best Wallet, MetaMask, and Trust Wallet to Electrum and OKX.

What is the safest decentralized crypto wallet?

The most secure decentralized wallets are hardware-based, with providers like Trezor and Ledger Nano leading the market, although users need to purchase physical devices which can be expensive.

Is Coinbase Wallet decentralized or centralized?

Yes, the Coinbase Wallet is a decentralized wallet that operates independently from the main Coinbase exchange.

Is Trust Wallet decentralized or centralized?

Yes, Trust Wallet is a decentralized wallet for iOS, Android, and Chrome browser extensions.

What fees do decentralized wallets charge?

Most decentralized wallets are free to use and maintain, with users only needing to cover gas fees when transferring funds.

How secure are decentralized crypto wallets?

While Decentralized wallets give users full control of their private keys away from centralized third parties, they are not immune to remote hacking attempts. Â Â

1. Mega Dice –Â  Fastest Payout Online Casino

Mega Dice is our best instant pay casino and one of our overall best Bitcoin casinos for several reasons – it utilizes Telegram and blockchain technology to facilitate instant, secure, and anonymous deposits and withdrawals that are processed instantly and come with no fees or limits.

Mega Dice offers a 200% matched bonus for the initial deposit, with a minimum of $20, which means if you deposited $100, you could benefit from a bonus of $200, provided all other wagering requirements are met. Mega Dice also offers 50 free spins and a $1 minimum deposit.Â 

The platform is operated by MIBS B.V., under the regulations and licensing of the Curacao Gaming Commission, and is available to players globally without the need for a VPN. Despite being fully licensed and regulated, it also provides anonymity to users with a KYC free sign-up – this feature is highly sought after by crypto proponents who do not want to have their online activities monitored and tracked.Â 

One thing that really sets it apart from the competition, however, is that it was the first provider in the world to offer licensed gambling to users through Telegram. Mega Dice games can be played directly through the Mega Dice Telegram Casino Bot. The bot redirects users to the popular messaging app and allows them to create an account instantly and anonymously, as well as play games directly on mobile.

The familiarity and popularity of Telegram, combined with the Mega Dice Casino, is a potent partnership that improves both accessibility and usability for customers. Telegram currently has over 700 million users, many of whom are interested in DeFi and Web3, and allows for instant deposits and withdrawals, with no fees or limits.Â 

More than a dozen different cryptocurrencies are accepted on fast cash-out casino Mega Dice, including BTC, ETH, LTC, BCH, USDT, XRP, TRX, ADA, and DOGE.Â 

In addition to its large variety of game offerings, with more than 5,000 slots available, as well as casino games, and a sportsbook. Mega Dice places great emphasis on providing good customer support, which is available 24/7. It’s a top online casino and could become even more prominent in 2023, thanks to its Telegram partnership which will vastly increase its appeal for users.Â

Considering that around 3,000 titles are available, Lucky Block is also one of the best Bitcoin slots sites. A full range of slots games are provided by leading developers such as NetEnt, Fantasma, and Microgaming. 3. TG.Casino – Telegram-Powered Casino with Huge Rewards

TG.Casino ($TGC) is an instant-withdrawal instant-deposit Telegram-powered crypto casino. It offers some of the best rewards to players in the space as its native token can be staked and will be used for a token buyback/burn scheme.

TG.Casino is another globally accessible casino that allows players to deposit and withdraw instantaneously through the Telegram messaging application. No account is required, there is no KYC whatsoever, and the player retains control over the funds. The minimum deposit is a $1 crypto equivalent and this is a legal endeavor, fully licensed with a base in Curacao.

Unlike legacy casinos, TG.Casino generates APY for token holders, currently in the region of 425%. The native token is not needed to play in the casino, though there is a 25% cashback advantage of losing bets placed in $TGC. There is a 200% welcome bonus for those who join, up to 10 ETH.

Aside from an easy onboarding process with instant deposits/withdrawals, TG.Casino has a different revenue generation mechanism than Web3 casinos. It uses its revenue to buy back the token and 40% of it is burned, promoting price appreciation for the coin. This means that token holders are in a sense shareholders of the platform. The $TGC token can be likened to stock, its price depending on how well the casino is performing.

The price per token is $0.125 and there are 40 million available in the presale, for a hard cap of $5 million. It has already reached its soft cap of $1 million and is nearly at the $1.2 million mark. To take part in the presale, a compatible Web3 wallet such as MetaMask is necessary. Acceptable cryptos include ETH, BNB, and USDT.

More information about this instant withdrawal casino can be found in the social accounts – Telegram or Twitter – along with the TG.Casino Whitepaper.

Instant Payout Online Casinos vs Fastest Paying Online Casinos

Fast payout online casinos are classified in two ways: instantaneous and fast. Instant withdrawal casinos have payment processing times of less than 24 hours. The time taken to process your request and to receive the money in your account is included. If you choose a fast payout casino, you will receive your money in three days.

Process Times Can Differ

Here are some cautions. The processing time includes the time required to approve your withdrawal request. Fast-payout online casinos may offer the same payment method but with different timings.

Casino A may approve requests in 12 hours, while Casino B could take 48. Casino A can complete crypto withdrawals within 24 hours. Casino B will take at least 48. Both casinos can be categorized as “fast payouts” because they offer fast payment methods, such as Bitcoin. When comparing specific timeframes, the casino offers faster payouts.

The Banking Methods Are Important

Online banking methods such as cryptocurrencies offer faster payouts than legacy banking methods such as debit cards. It’s because legacy financial systems were designed on the internet. These systems use different protocols for online banking. Digital wallets offer the fastest payouts.

The Fastest Methods of Withdrawal at Instant Withdrawal Casinos – A Breakdown

While we have talked much about fast withdrawals at online casinos, we have yet to say much about payment methods. Below is a list of the most efficient and popular ways to pay.

Cryptocurrency

Cryptocurrencies have become the dominant payment method within the offshore betting domain, with digital tokens establishing a robust value correlation to the US dollar. Their exceptional speed and security have positioned cryptocurrencies as the preeminent choice for transactions, particularly favored by fast-payout casinos that routinely process withdrawals within 24 to 48 hours. These instantaneous transactions, following operator approval, make cryptocurrencies a cornerstone in the architecture of instant withdrawal casinos.

There is a slight trade-off: engaging with cryptocurrencies requires registration with a digital exchange, where players can purchase, deposit, and withdraw their digital currencies. Although platforms such as CoinBase are integral to this process, they may impose additional withdrawal fees. Nevertheless, cryptocurrency transactions’ swift and secure nature continues to make them an attractive option for savvy online players seeking efficiency and confidentiality in their financial dealings.

Visa and Mastercard

Visa and MasterCard stand as the titans of global payment processing, their ubiquitous presence and esteemed reputation assuring users of secure and proficient withdrawal transactions. Industry pioneers guarantee a standard of safety and efficiency recognized worldwide. Withdrawals via these networks are systematically processed within three to five business days, a testament to their steadfast service. Notably, Las Atlantis is among the select operators that accommodate withdrawals through these channels, reflecting their international acclaim for excellence.

However, it’s important to acknowledge that while Visa and MasterCard are synonymous with reliability, they do not specialize in the rapidity of transactions. As such, for those prioritizing speed, these providers do not fall into the category of fast withdrawal options. Despite this, their entrenched standing in the financial services sector continues to make them a favored choice for users who value security and establishing trust over immediacy.

PayPal & Ewallets

The advent of cryptocurrencies has markedly overshadowed Ewallets, with only the premier offshore casinos in the US continuing to recognize their value amidst the crypto fervor. E-wallets, including the likes of PayPal, have faced a downturn primarily due to stringent regulatory measures and escalating fees affecting their usage. Despite this shift, PayPal has adeptly positioned itself as a critical intermediary, enabling users to fund their cryptocurrency wallets efficiently. This strategic pivot ensures that PayPal remains an integral player in the ecosystem of fast payouts, facilitating using crypto tokens for immediate transactions.

Bank Transfer

Bank transfers, commonly referred to as wire transfers, are meticulously vetted by both the online casino’s security team and the banking institution, which inherently prolongs their processing time compared to cryptocurrency and debit card withdrawals. This deliberate pace ensures the utmost security, facilitating the safe transfer of funds from Point A to Point B. Widely accepted by most operators, bank transfers typically complete within 3 to 10 working days, upholding rigorous standards to safeguard your assets.

For large-sum transactions, bank transfers are unparalleled in handling high-value exchanges with unassailable security. Directly depositing funds into your bank account allows you to utilize your money online and offline. While the transaction time may extend up to 10 days, the assurance of safety and suitability for substantial financial movements firmly establishes bank transfers as the foremost method for high-stakes players.

Check by courier

Checks by courier stand as the time-honored method of payouts, retaining their popularity among those who prefer not to engage with cryptocurrencies or disclose bank account details, as well as among high rollers who require the convenience of receiving sizable payouts in one go. This method, steeped in tradition, involves the operator issuing a check, which is dispatched directly to your doorstep through international courier services.

The process exemplifies reliability and caters to significant withdrawal requests, providing a secure alternative to digital transactions. Although it may not match the speed of electronic transfers, with deliveries taking up to five days, checks by courier are an exemplary option for those valuing physical checks and high withdrawal capacities without modern technological involvement.

How We Rated Best Instant Withdrawal Casinos

We rated the casinos on this list from a wide variety of criteria and then weighed them against rival instant pay casinos to complete our list. We looked at the speed with which cryptos could be deposited and withdrawn, if there were any fees or limits imposed on crypto transfers and if the casino offered a variety of tokens to deposit and withdraw.

The best online casinos that payout instantly tended to offer no fees or limits, instant payout for certain cryptos, a decent number of cryptos to play with beyond the biggest cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, and USDT.

While these characteristics were given the most weight, our rating also factored in several other key features that players want. That included the size of the welcome bonus and the difficulty with which it is to attain due to wagering requirements, as well as other promotions or bonuses such as free spins, rakeback, and cashback.

The overall user experience was considered, with ease of creating an account, playing games, whether it had a mobile app, its security and anonymity, and also licensing and regulation considered, as well as the quality of its customer support.

Selection of games was another major consideration, with those offering a larger number of games – as well as favorites including Plinko and Aviator – given higher marks. We looked at not only the slots on offer but also classic casino games such as poker, blackjack, and roulette, and whether those tables had virtual and/or live dealers, multiple languages, and tables suitable for novice and pro players.

Crypto sports betting was also another hugely popular element in determining rankings on this list, with the best online casinos that payout instantly offering pre-game and in-play markets, bet builders, and specials for a wide variety of sports, and major and minor competitions.

Finally, we looked at if the casino had any other features that helped them to stand out from the crowd – our top two choices Mega Dice and Lucky Block, for example, utilize Telegram to make account creation and crypto deposits and withdrawals instant, secure, and anonymous, while games can be played directly on the app on mobile.

Selecting the Fastest Payout Online Casinos With Instant Withdrawal – What to Look forÂ 

When choosing the best online casino with instant withdrawal, players will need to look for a range of metrics to make the right decision.Â 

Here’s what we looked for ranking the top online casinos with instant payouts that we reviewed in the above sections.Â 

Withdrawal Times

It goes without saying that one of the main factors players look for when choosing a crypto casino is the speed that withdrawals are processed.Â In the vast bulk of cases, the providers discussed today offer instant, or near-instant withdrawals. This means that the casino will transfer the funds as soon as the payout request is made.Â 

After that, the speed of the transaction will be determined by the respective blockchain network. For example, at Lucky Block, Dogecoin and BNB withdrawals are usually received in about one minute.Â 

KYC and PrivacyÂ 

The best online casinos with instant withdrawals offer KYC-free accounts. In other words, upon signing up, the casino will only ask for an email address. This appeals to gamblers as there is no need to provide a proof of ID or address. Â 

Payout Limits and FeesÂ 

We typically avoid online casinos that have withdrawal limits in place. Ultimately, if a player wins a large jackpot, they should be able to withdraw all of the funds in one transaction. We also prefer Bitcoin casinos that offer fee-free withdrawals. Lucky Block and Metaspins are two examples of Bitcoin gambling sites that do not charge players to cash out. Â 

Supported GamesÂ 

Top-rated crypto casinos offer thousands of games, from blackjack and roulette to video poker and dice.Â Games should be backed by reputable software developers too. Lucky Block has partnered with more than 80 developers – including industry heavyweights such as Microgaming and NetEnt.Â

Â Note: Those searching for a no deposit instant withdrawal crypto casino will be disappointed – as no such gambling site exists. Instead, when claiming a no deposit bonus, the funds will need to be wagered a number of times – often at 40x or more. Â 

How do Crypto Casino Payouts Work?

Those that are completely new to crypto casinos might be wondering how withdrawals actually work. The process is actually very simple and in most cases, consistent across all casinos in this space.Â 

  • First, the player will be required to make a withdrawal request.Â 
  • This is usually just a case of logging into the account and selecting the relevant withdrawal button.Â 
  • The player will need to paste in the wallet address that they wish to receive the funds in addition to the payout amount.Â 
  • After making the request, it is then up to the online casino to approve it.Â 

The top-rated platforms discussed on this page will typically approve a withdrawal request autonomously. This means that there is no requirement for the casino to manually verify the payout. As a result, the cryptocurrencies will leave the online casino and head over to the player’s wallet. The timing of the transfer at this stage will depend on the respective blockchain.Â 

As noted above, XRP, Dogecoin, and BNB withdrawals at Lucky Block are usually received in one minute, while Bitcoin is slightly slower.Â With that being said, there might be occasions where withdrawals are not processed by the Bitcoin casino instantly. This might be because the player is withdrawing a large amount from the casino and thus, it needs to be manually checked.Â 

How Fast Are Casino Withdrawals?

The timeframe associated with withdrawals from a online casino can and will vary from one provider to the next. The purpose of this comparison guide was to focus on casinos that offer instant withdrawals – meaning, payouts are processed as soon as the request is made (or several minutes after). This is the case when using Lucky Block, but this isn’t the industry standard.

For example, some Bitcoin casinos will take up to an hour to process a withdrawal request. This is still considered fast, especially when compared to fiat casinos – which can take several days.Â On the flip side, if a crypto casino takes more than 24 hours to approve a withdrawal, this is considered slow. As such, this type of casino should be avoided.Â 

Ultimately, there is no justification for a fastest payout online casino to hold onto a player’s winnings for a lengthy period of time. After all, the winnings belong to the player, so the funds should be transferred to the requested wallet without delay. Apart from the ones mentioned on this list, another casino that delivers fast payment is Crashino Casino.

Check out our guide to discover more information about Crashino Casino.

Here is a short overview of the fast withdrawal definitions:

  • Instant Withdrawals:Â Instant withdrawals are exactly how they sound; the casino approves payout requests immediately. This is only the case with casinos that specialize in cryptocurrency withdrawals. So, when withdrawing Bitcoin, the tokens should arrive in about 10-15 minutes. When withdrawing altcoins, the timeframe is significantly reduced â often taking just 1-2 minutes.Â 
  • Fast Withdrawals:Â Fast withdrawals are not instant, but they are much quicker than the industry average. We view a withdrawal as âfastâ if the casino approves it in under an hour.Â Once again, withdrawals processed this quickly are usually reserved for cryptocurrency payouts only. Nonetheless, once approved, the tokens should arrive in the playerâs private wallet in a few minutes. Â Â 
  • Average Withdrawals:Â On average, the vast majority of online casinos take between 24-48 hours to approve withdrawals. This is usually the case when depositing and withdrawing funds with traditional payment methods. For example, debit/credit cards and bank wires.Â The reason for this is simple; fiat money payments have much stricter anti-money laundering rules. This means that the casino will need to manually review the withdrawals before it can approve it.Â

    For example:

    • Lucky Block matches the first deposit by 200% (up to â¬10,000)
    • Suppose a player deposits the SHIB equivalent of â¬1,000Â

    Free Spins

    Many welcome packages offered by Shiba Inu online casinos include free spins. For example, Lucky Block adds 50 free spins to its 200% matched deposit offer.Â 

    In other instances, free spins are offered on a weekly basis when meeting minimum deposit requirements. Cloudbet, for example, offers 20 free spins when players deposit at least â¬20.Â 

    Free spins are risk-free, as the account balance is not used. However, winnings made from the free spins usually need to be wagered before a withdrawal can be made.Â 

    No Deposit Bonuses

    Another promotion to look for is a ‘no deposit’ bonus. This offers free casino credits, chips, or free spins without needing to add funds to the account.Â 

    In most cases, the wagering requirements will be unfavorable. Moreover, no deposit bonuses are rare these days. Instead, the best Shiba Inu casinos that we reviewed offer matched deposit bonuses. Â Â 

    VIP Club

    Casinos that accept Shiba Inu usually reward loyalty via a VIP club. Usually, players will accumulate points when placing wagers. Points can then be converted into bonuses and/or prizes.Â 

    For example, Cloudbet points can be exchanged for risk-free bets, matched deposit bonuses, and even luxury holidays.Â 

    Deposit ReloadsÂ 

    We also found that the best Shiba Inu casino sites offer deposit reloads to existing players. For example, Lucky Block matches deposits by 40% each and every Monday.

    Once again, remember that winnings made from deposit reloads will need to be wagered. Specific wagering requirements will vary depending on the Shiba Inu casino and the respective bonus.Â 

    Shiba Inu Casino Bonuses: OverviewÂ 

    Here’s an overview of the best Shiba Inu casino bonuses alongside their required wagering terms and promo code.

    Always check the terms and conditions of a Shiba Inu casino bonus before claiming it.Â 

    Is it Safe to Gamble With SHIB?

    Many experts claim that gambling with SHIB and other cryptocurrencies is much safer than using a traditional casino. Not only are payments made on a wallet-to-wallet basis, but players are rarely asked for sensitive KYC documents.

    When compared to regular casinos, gambling with SHIB is very safe.Â 

    For example, traditional online casinos demand a vast amount of personal information from players. This is in addition to KYC documents, such as passports, driving licenses, and bank statements. Should these documents get into the wrong hands, players are vulnerable to identity theft.Â 

    In contrast, gambling with Shiba Inu is usually anonymous. This means players only need to provide an email address to get started. What’s more, this is only collected by the casino should the player forget their password.Â 

    Another safety net when gambling with SHIB is that payments are processed anonymously and away from the casino site. This is because deposits are made from the player’s private wallet. And hence, SHIB casinos do not collect financial details like credit card numbers.Â 

    That said, players should still err on the side of caution. Not all Shiba Inu casinos are legitimate. Moreover, players need to trust that the SHIB casino will honor payouts. This is why it’s best to stick with reputable casinos like Lucky Block, Cloudbet, and BC.Game.Â 

    In terms of the legality of gambling with SHIB, this still falls within a gray area of the law. While the specifics will vary from country to country, most gambling regulations do not cover digital assets.Â 

    Furthermore, the anonymous and borderless nature of crypto casinos makes the industry challenging to regulate. For example, while many crypto casinos ban US clients, this is often circumvented by VPNs. Â 

    Conclusion

    In summary, players have ample choice when gambling with SHIB online. But players should remember that not all Shiba Inu casinos are created equal. While some offer instant and limitless payouts, others take days to honor winnings.Â

    It’s also beneficial if the casino is easy to navigate and signing up is quick and simple.

    Bitcoin Keno: How it Works

    Bitcoin keno is the online version of the classic game, only players pay for their stake with BTC tokens instead of fiat funds. Players choose a specified amount of numbers and match as many as possible to those that are drawn – it’s comparable to a lottery.

    The basic concept of keno is to choose numbers from a table and place bets on them in the hope of them being drawn. Like with lottery games, the more numbers a player correctly matches, the higher the winnings.

    • Most keno games have a grid containing up to 80 numbers and allow the player to pick up to 10.Â 
    • However, there are many other variations with different rules.
    • For instance, in Keno Rush, players choose up to 10 numbers from a grid for 40.Â 
    • In the Scribe version, players must choose up to 10 numbers from a grid of 36.Â 
    • Keno Goal, offered by BC.Game, allows players to select up to 20 numbers.

    Some keno games are provably fair. For instance, at Lucky Block, all keno draws are carried out via smart contracts for fairness. As such, players can verify the results to ensure the keno draw was fair and true.

    Bitcoin Keno Casino Bonuses

    Read on to see the best Bitcoin keno casino bonuses on offer in 2023:

    Matched Deposit

    Matched deposit bonuses are offered by many of the top Bitcoin keno sites we’ve reviewed today.Â 

    For instance:

    • Lucky Block matches the first deposit by 200% up to the value of â¬10,000
    • BC.Game offers four matched deposit bonuses of up to 1,260%
    • Cloudbet welcomes new players by matching their first deposit by 100% up to 5 BTC

    This provides players with free funds to get started. That said, players should research any wagering requirements attached to the bonus and ensure they understand them in full.

    Risk-Free Spins

    Free spin bonuses are a standard offering at many Bitcoin keno sites, despite the two not being related. Free spins are sometimes offered as part of the welcome package.Â 

    For instance, Lucky Block players are given 50 free spins when signing up. Oftentimes, casinos have free spin bonuses for existing players as well. For instance, Lucky Block offers one deposit reload each week to all registered users. Â 

    VIP Program Perks

    Some casinos offer points when gamblers play keno with crypto. This enables players to climb the VIP ladder.

    The higher the VIP status, the more bonuses and benefits they will earn. This might include cashback, rakeback, and exclusive offers.

    No Deposit Bonus

    The no deposit bonus is hard to come by these days. Nonetheless, this provides players with bonus funds for signing up, and they will not need to make a deposit in order to claim them.

    None of the Bitcoin keno casinos we’ve reviewed today offer no deposit bonuses. This is largely because they are crypto-based and transactions are anonymous. As such, regulating who has already claimed the offer would be difficult.

    How to Play Keno With Bitcoin

    Here’s an overview of how to play keno with Bitcoin:

    • Choose a Reputable Casino: The first step is to pick the best Bitcoin keno casino and sign up for an account. At crypto-focussed casinos like Lucky Block, this only involves entering an email username, and password.
    • Pick a Keno Game: All keno games have similar rules but will vary in the size of the grid and how many numbers can be chosen. Traditionally, keno has 80 numbers, and players pick 10. Provably fair variants usually include a grid of 36. Â 
    • Select Some Numbers: Next, the player needs to choose the numbers they think will be drawn. Alternatively, it’s also possible to choose the numbers at random.
    • Begin Playing: Place a bet and start playing keno. Some casinos accept stakes as low as $0.20 for keno games. The more numbers a player matches to what is drawn, the more they will win.Â 

    Players should check the RTP and risk level of each keno game before proceeding. And of course, players should gamble responsibly. Moreover, if the casino offers free Bitcoin keno, players can play for fun without risking any funds.

    To Conclude

    Its welcome offer is a generous 200% matched deposit bonus with 50 free spins. Moreover, payouts are instant, and there are no KYC requirements – so signing up is quick and easy.

    Not only that, but Mega Dice supports various keno games, ensuring that players are always entertained.Â

    Tips on Selecting the Best Avalanche Casino: Our Criteria

    Payments

    • For example, Lucky Block processes deposits automatically.Â 
    • The player’s account is credited once confirmed by the blockchain.Â

    • Lucky Block also approves withdrawal requests instantly.Â 

    In contrast, some Avalanche casinos take several days to process payouts. These casino sites should be avoided.Â 

    Another factor to consider when researching AVAX casino sites is withdrawal limits. While platforms like Lucky Block and Cloubet have no limits in place. others do. For instance, some AVAX casinos have a maximum weekly withdrawal amount. If the player lands a big win, this can be problematic.Â 

    Account Opening ProcessÂ 

    The best Avalanche casinos offer a completely anonymous experience. This means that opening an account requires nothing more than an email address. And certainly no KYC documents.Â 

    That said, some AVAX gambling sites are legally mandated to ask for ID. This is because they also accept fiat money, so KYC is required to stay compliant with anti-money laundering laws.Â 

    Bonuses and PromotionsÂ 

    Players should also consider bonuses and promotions when choosing an Avalanche casino. All of the casinos discussed today offer a welcome package. This boosts the player’s first deposit by a certain percentage.Â

    Is it Safe to Gamble With AVAX?

    While most AVAX casinos are safe, gamblers should be aware that not all platforms are created equal. The anonymous nature of cryptocurrencies means that some AVAX casinos will turn out to be scams. Fortunately, there are plenty of legitimate AVAX casinos to choose from – including Lucky Block, Cloudbet, and BC.Game.

    In most cases, gambling with Avalanche is completely safe. In fact, when compared to traditional casinos, crypto-centric platforms offer additional safety features.Â 

    • For example, the best Avalanche online casinos do not ask players to provide any personal information.Â 
    • Nor is there a need to upload KYC documents, like a passport or driver’s license.Â 
    • This removes the risk of being a victim of identity fraud.
    • KYC-free accounts also allow players to gamble without transactions appearing in their name.Â 

    What’s more, AVAX casinos accept deposits on a wallet-to-wallet basis. This means that deposits are not made directly on the casino’s website. Just like funding a crypto exchange account, AVAX casino deposits are made from a private wallet.Â 

    Another safeguard is that some AVAX casinos are regulated. For example, Lucky Block holds a gambling licence issued by the CuraÃ§ao Gaming Control Board. This ensures that best practices for safety and security are met. For example, beneficial owners of the casino will need to be identified before the license is issued.Â 

    All that being said, not all AVAX casinos are credible. On the contrary, a small minority of platforms let the wider industry down. Unscrupulous tactics to look for include limiting betting and withdrawal sizes, unnecessarily slow payouts, and unethical terms and conditions.Â
